name: University of South-Eastern Norway
memberOrga: We are a Public University With 1600 employees and over 18, 000 students.
goal:
The University of South-Eastern Norway (USN) is the country’s newest University. USN is headed by Rector Petter Aasen. The Rector reports to USN's Board, which is chaired by Professor Rune Nilsen. We have around 18,000 students and 1,600 staff, spread over eight campuses: Drammen, Vestfold, Kongsberg, Ringerike, Bø, Notodden, Porsgrunn and Rauland. The University of South-Eastern Norway aims to have a regional foundation, and with eight campuses, we have a strong and clear presence in one of Norway’s most exciting and dynamic regions.

Increased internationalization of education and research is a key goal for the University. USN is an internationally
oriented, regionally based and entrepreneurial university with a strong work community and With society and industry as close collaborative partners. Through professional and industry-oriented research and education, the university contributes knowledge and skills for solving the world's climate, energy and poverty challenges, ensuring the sustainability of the welfare state and strengthening interpersonal relationships in a globalised world.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: All EU initiatives related to research, education and innovation such at Horizon 2020 and ERASMUS+.
